statements: SELECT * FROM cybersecurity_data
SELECT id, username FROM cybersecurity_data
SELECT password FROM cybersecurity_data WHERE id = 1
SELECT * FROM cybersecurity_data WHERE username LIKE 'A%'
SELECT email FROM cybersecurity_data WHERE id IN (1, 2, 3)
SELECT * FROM cybersecurity_data ORDER BY username ASC
SELECT id, username, email FROM cybersecurity_data WHERE username = 'admin'
SELECT DISTINCT username FROM cybersecurity_data
SELECT * FROM cybersecurity_data WHERE email IS NULL
SELECT COUNT(*) FROM cybersecurity_data
SELECT MAX(id) FROM cybersecurity_data
SELECT * FROM cybersecurity_data WHERE id BETWEEN 1 AND 10
SELECT AVG(id) FROM cybersecurity_data
SELECT MIN(id) FROM cybersecurity_data
SELECT * FROM cybersecurity_data WHERE password = 'pass123'
SELECT username, email FROM cybersecurity_data WHERE id = 5
SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT username) FROM cybersecurity_data
SELECT * FROM cybersecurity_data WHERE email LIKE '%@example.com'
SELECT * FROM cybersecurity_data WHERE id = (SELECT MAX(id) FROM cybersecurity_data)
SELECT * FROM cybersecurity_data WHERE id <> 1
SELECT * FROM users;
SELECT id, username FROM users;
SELECT * FROM users WHERE id = 1;
SELECT * FROM users WHERE username LIKE 'j%';
SELECT id, email FROM users WHERE id > 10;
SELECT id, username, email FROM users WHERE email LIKE '%@gmail.com';
SELECT * FROM users ORDER BY username ASC;
SELECT * FROM users ORDER BY id DESC;
SELECT COUNT(*) FROM users;
SELECT AVG(id) FROM users;
SELECT MAX(id) FROM users;
SELECT MIN(id) FROM users;
SELECT DISTINCT username FROM users;
SELECT * FROM users LIMIT 5;
SELECT * FROM users OFFSET 2;
SELECT * FROM users WHERE username = 'admin' AND password = 'admin123';
SELECT id, username FROM users WHERE id IN (1, 2, 3);
SELECT id, email FROM users WHERE email NOT LIKE '%@example.com';
SELECT * FROM users WHERE id BETWEEN 5 AND 10;
SELECT username, COUNT(*) FROM users GROUP BY username;
SELECT * FROM users;
SELECT * FROM users WHERE username = 'john_doe';
SELECT username, email FROM users WHERE user_id = 1;
SELECT * FROM incidents;
SELECT incident_type, description FROM incidents WHERE incident_id = 100;
SELECT * FROM logs;
SELECT log_type, timestamp FROM logs WHERE user_id = 1;
SELECT u.username, l.log_type FROM users u JOIN logs l ON u.user_id = l.user_id;
SELECT u.username, i.incident_type FROM users u JOIN incidents i ON u.user_id = i.reported_by;
SELECT u.username, l.message FROM users u LEFT JOIN logs l ON u.user_id = l.user_id;
SELECT u.username, COUNT(l.log_id) AS total_logs FROM users u LEFT JOIN logs l ON u.user_id = l.user_id GROUP BY u.username;
SELECT MIN(log_id) AS min_log_id FROM logs;
SELECT MAX(log_id) AS max_log_id FROM logs;
SELECT AVG(log_id) AS avg_log_id FROM logs;
SELECT SUM(log_id) AS total_log_id FROM logs;
SELECT DISTINCT log_type FROM logs;
SELECT * FROM incidents WHERE incident_type LIKE '%security%';
SELECT * FROM logs WHERE timestamp BETWEEN '2022-01-01' AND '2022-01-31';
SELECT COUNT(*) AS total_users FROM users;
SELECT COUNT(*) AS total_incidents FROM incidents;
SELECT * FROM users
SELECT user_id, username, email FROM users
SELECT role_name, description FROM roles
SELECT user_id, role_id FROM user_roles
SELECT * FROM permissions
SELECT user_id, username, role FROM users INNER JOIN user_roles ON users.user_id = user_roles.user_id INNER JOIN roles ON user_roles.role_id = roles.role_id
SELECT u.username, r.role_name FROM users u JOIN user_roles ur ON u.user_id = ur.user_id JOIN roles r ON ur.role_id = r.role_id

SELECT u.username, r.role_name, p.permission_name FROM users u JOIN user_roles ur ON u.user_id = ur.user_id JOIN roles r ON ur.role_id = r.role_id JOIN permissions p ON r.role_name = p.permission_name
SELECT user_id, email, role_name FROM users JOIN user_roles ON users.user_id = user_roles.user_id JOIN roles ON user_roles.role_id = roles.role_id

SELECT u.username, r.role_name, p.permission_name, r.description FROM users u JOIN user_roles ur ON u.user_id = ur.user_id JOIN roles r ON ur.role_id = r.role_id JOIN permissions p ON r.role_name = p.permission_name
SELECT user_id, username, email FROM users WHERE user_id > 10
SELECT role_name FROM roles WHERE role_id = 3
SELECT permission_name, description FROM permissions WHERE permission_name LIKE '%read%'
SELECT u.username, r.role_name FROM users u JOIN user_roles ur ON u.user_id = ur.user_id JOIN roles r ON ur.role_id = r.role_id WHERE u.user_id = 1
SELECT * FROM users ORDER BY username ASC
SELECT * FROM roles ORDER BY role_name DESC
SELECT username, email FROM users WHERE role = 'admin'
SELECT u.username, r.role_name FROM users u JOIN user_roles ur ON u.user_id = ur.user_id JOIN roles r ON ur.role_id = r.role_id WHERE r.description = 'Read Only'
SELECT u.username, r.role_name FROM users u JOIN user_roles ur ON u.user_id = ur.user_id JOIN roles r ON ur.role_id = r.role_id WHERE u.username = 'john_doe'
SELECT u.username AS user_alias, r.role_name AS role_alias FROM users u JOIN user_roles ur ON u.user_id = ur.user_id JOIN roles r ON ur.role_id = r.role_id
SELECT * FROM users
SELECT id, username FROM users
SELECT username, password FROM users WHERE id = 1
SELECT id, role_name FROM roles
SELECT * FROM permissions
SELECT id, permission_name FROM permissions WHERE id = 1
SELECT user_id, role_id FROM user_roles
SELECT role_id, permission_id FROM role_permissions
SELECT users.id, users.username, roles.id, roles.role_name FROM users INNER JOIN user_roles ON users.id = user_roles.user_id INNER JOIN roles ON user_roles.role_id = roles.id
SELECT roles.role_name, COUNT(*) AS total_users FROM user_roles INNER JOIN roles ON user_roles.role_id = roles.id GROUP BY roles.role_name

SELECT users.username, permissions.permission_name FROM users INNER JOIN user_roles ON users.id = user_roles.user_id INNER JOIN roles ON user_roles.role_id = roles.id INNER JOIN role_permissions ON roles.id = role_permissions.role_id INNER JOIN permissions ON role_permissions.permission_id = permissions.id
SELECT * FROM users WHERE username LIKE 'A%'
SELECT * FROM user_roles WHERE user_id = 1

SELECT roles.role_name, permissions.permission_name FROM roles INNER JOIN role_permissions ON roles.id = role_permissions.role_id INNER JOIN permissions ON role_permissions.permission_id = permissions.id
SELECT * FROM users LIMIT 5
SELECT * FROM permissions WHERE permission_name = 'admin'
SELECT DISTINCT role_name FROM roles
SELECT MAX(id) AS max_user_id FROM users
SELECT MIN(id) AS min_role_id FROM roles
